I’m reading this paper and it says to do the following after doing a GLM to calculate the P values.
```Wald test

The Wald test compares the beta estimate β ir divided by its estimated standard error SE(β ir ) to a standard normal distribution```
Isn’t this just a regular t-test/z-test? How is this a wald test

text: We have <#C6821M4KE|statistics> btw. But yes it is a t/z test. Another name for a Z test is Wald test. Its basically when you have to use the CLT assumption for the MLE being normal, as is common in GLMs and other methods
